H0.text: Mass is the property that would best help a student determine if two substances are made of two different elements.

H1.text: Shape is the property that would best help a student determine whether two substances are made of two different elements.

H2.text: Density is the property that would best help a student determine if two substances are made of two different elements.

H3.text: Volume is the property that best helps a student determine whether two substances are composed of two different elements.

A4.text: There is so great a difference in density between salt and fresh water that vessels laden with cargoes of the same weight almost sink in rivers, but ride quite easily at sea and are quite seaworthy.

A5.text: If you make water very salt by mixing salt in with it, eggs will float on it.
